channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This sport's athletes may be the fittest of them all, at least by one metric
item.description: Scientists have measured all kinds of athletes, and one sport consistently come out on top for maximizing the body's ability to convert oxygen to energy.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have measured all kinds of athletes, and one sport consistently come out on top for maximizing the body's ability to convert oxygen to energy.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Venezuela's oil revival brings hope — but little relief for workers
item.description: As U.S. sanctions ease and oil money begins to trickle back after Nicolás Maduro's removal, Venezuelans weigh hopes for recovery against the harsh reality of surviving on wages that barely cover food.
item.content:encoded: As U.S. sanctions ease and oil money begins to trickle back after Nicolás Maduro's removal, Venezuelans weigh hopes for recovery against the harsh reality of surviving on wages that barely cover food.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Trump's immigration crackdown is affecting politics in Maine
item.description: President Trump's immigration crackdown is complicating Republicans' attempts to maintain control of Congress in this year's midterm elections. That dynamic is evident especially in Maine.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's immigration crackdown is complicating Republicans' attempts to maintain control of Congress in this year's midterm elections. That dynamic is evident especially in Maine.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Miller

item.title: Despite the war and Russian missile attacks, residents of Kyiv go ice fishing
item.description: Despite the war and Russian missile attacks, residents of Ukraine's capital Kyiv go ice fishing on the Dnipro river bisecting their city.
item.content:encoded: Despite the war and Russian missile attacks, residents of Ukraine's capital Kyiv go ice fishing on the Dnipro river bisecting their city.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Cities ditch license plate readers over privacy worries
item.description: Cities around the country are debating whether to keep their automatic license plate readers. Concerns about privacy and federal immigration agents can access local data are driving these debates.
item.content:encoded: Cities around the country are debating whether to keep their automatic license plate readers. Concerns about privacy and federal immigration agents can access local data are driving these debates.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: How Rev. Jesse Jackson transformed American politics
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with CNN's Abby Phillip about the life and legacy of civil rights leader Rev. Jesse Jackson, who died at 84.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with CNN's Abby Phillip about the life and legacy of civil rights leader Rev. Jesse Jackson, who died at 84.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: American speed skaters take silver in Olympic team pursuit race
item.description: U.S. speed skaters competed in the team pursuit Tuesday. The U.S. men are taking home a silver medal in the speedskating Team Pursuit, and more exciting races are coming up this week.
item.content:encoded: U.S. speed skaters competed in the team pursuit Tuesday. The U.S. men are taking home a silver medal in the speedskating Team Pursuit, and more exciting races are coming up this week.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Meet Yolanda the wax truck, Team USA's unsung cross-country ski hero
item.description: Fast skiers require fast skis. They rely on a team of technicians to wax and prep them for each day's conditions. The U.S. cross-country team has a mobile ski shop that is an unsung hero of their success: Yolanda the wax truck.
item.content:encoded:
Fast skiers require fast skis. They rely on a team of technicians to wax and prep them for each day's conditions. The U.S. cross-country team has a mobile ski shop that is an unsung hero of their success: Yolanda the wax truck.

(Image credit: Eric Whitney)
item.dc:creator: Eric Whitney

item.title: AI is helping individual scientists, study suggests — but not science
item.description: Artificial intelligence is helping researchers advance their careers and drill deeper into specific questions, but it is not necessarily benefiting science on the whole.
item.content:encoded: Artificial intelligence is helping researchers advance their careers and drill deeper into specific questions, but it is not necessarily benefiting science on the whole.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: In 'A Poet,' the artist trades torture for levity
item.description: Director Simon Mesa Soto talks about his indie film A Poet and how filmmaking can serve as catharsis.
item.content:encoded: Director Simon Mesa Soto talks about his indie film A Poet and how filmmaking can serve as catharsis.
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo
